entry.title: Bridge returned error 500! (18504)
entry.content:
abolishicedenver - Instagram Bridge was unable to receive or process the remote website's content!
Error message: `Unable to find username in search result.`
Query string: `action=display&bridge=Instagram&context=Username&u=abolishicedenver&media_type=all&direct_links=on&format=Atom`
Version: `dev.2020-02-26`

  • Press Return to check your input parameters
  • Press F5 to retry
  • Check if this issue was already reported on GitHub (give it a thumbs-up)
  • Open a GitHub Issue if this error persists

entry.title: üëÄ üëÄ
entry.content:
Abolish ICE Denver

üëÄ üëÄ

‚ÄéParty for Socialism and Liberation - Denver‚Äé to Denver-Aurora March Against Racism & Police Violence

IMPORTANT INFO FOR TODAY‚ÄôS MARCH:

There will be limited parking at the MLK Library, but lots of street parking nearby.

IF YOU ARE DRIVING WITH THE MARCH:...
‚Ä¢ Please park wherever you are able to nearby. You can join us for the rally on foot then head back to your car afterwards, or tune into the rally livestream on our Facebook page from your car, if you prefer to remain in your vehicle.
‚Ä¢ Please be sure to tune into our Facebook livestream for the opening rally and (IMPORTANT!) your cue when to pull onto Colfax to join the march. Cars driving with the protest will be filling in behind the marchers.
‚Ä¢ Once the march reaches City Park, unfortunately drivers will not be able to pull up to the MLK memorial for the closing rally, as driving into the park is blocked off. We will livestream the closing rally on our Facebook page.

IF YOU ARE MARCHING ON FOOT:
‚Ä¢ Please be aware that the march will end at City Park in Denver. You can catch the 15 RTD bus back after the closing rally at the Colfax & Elizabeth St stop. The bus comes roughly every ten minutes and goes directly East on Colfax back to the starting point (no transfers needed).
‚Ä¢ You may also consider pairing with someone you know who is attending. One person can park near City Park in Denver, then you can drive together to the MLK Library. After the march ends, the person parked at the end point can give the other a ride back to their car.

Thanks and see you at 2PM!

See More

entry.title: "On Sunday, August 23, a Turtle Mountain Chippewa man was...
entry.content:
Abolish ICE Denver

"On Sunday, August 23, a Turtle Mountain Chippewa man was shot and killed by police in Belcourt, North Dakota on the Turtle Mountain Indian Reservation, according to a statement made by the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI). Law enforcement is currently providing little details about the shooting at a private residence.

The deceased is Brandon Laducer, 35, of Belcourt, North Dakota. He was a father to two children, a boy and a girl.

In an email, FBI spokesperson Kevin Smi...th shared that police were involved in a shooting at a home in Belcourt, North Dakota late Saturday night, August 22 and into the early morning hours of Sunday, August 23.

The FBI was called to respond to the shooting, and the North Dakota Bureau of Criminal Investigation assisted with processing the scene, according to the email.

The FBI reported the law enforcement agencies involved in the incident were the Bureau of Indian Affairs (BIA), the Rolette County Sheriff‚Äôs Office, the Rolette Police Department and the Rolla Police Department.

Phone calls to the Rolette County Sheriff‚Äôs Department, the Rolette Police Department, and the Rolla Police Department were met with script-like responses of ‚Äúthat‚Äôs tribal‚Äù, leading to this reporter calling the Turtle Mountain Chippewa Tribal Office. Over the phone, a receptionist shared the phone number for the Bureau of Indian Affairs Turtle Mountain Agency and the BIA stated over the phone that any questions should be directed to the FBI field office in Minneapolis, Minnesota, nearly 500 miles away.

When asked for more information about the incident, FBI spokesperson Kevin Smith said the incident was ‚Äúa shooting while officers were present‚Äù and ‚Äúthe circumstances of the shooting (the who, what, when, where and why) are all part of the investigation.‚Äù No other information is being shared with the public."

See the full story, which includes a detailed analysis of the complications of police interactions in Indian Country:

https://unicornriot.ninja/‚Ä¶/tribal-member-killed-bia-offic‚Ä¶/

Contributed by Darren Thompson

See MoreLittle details are known after the police killed a Turtle Mountain Chippewa man at a private residence on the Turtle Mountain Indian Reservation in North Dakota.

unicornriot.ninja

Tribal Member Killed, BIA Officer Suspended, Family Knows Nothing on Turtle Mountain Indian Reservation - UNICORN RIOT

Little details are known after the police killed a Turtle Mountain Chippewa man at a private residence on the Turtle Mountain Indian Reservation in North Dakota.Little details are known after the police killed a Turtle Mountain Chippewa man at a private residence on the Turtle Mountain Indian Reservation in North Dakota.

AURORA, Colo. (KDVR) ‚Äî Three Aurora lawmakers are pushing for the Aurora Police Department to cease the use of military equipment and chemical weapons such as tear gas and pepper balls. Counc‚Ä¶

entry.title: ‚ÄúJust 13 protesters were able to hold up delivery of materials...
entry.content:
Abolish ICE Denver

‚ÄúJust 13 protesters were able to hold up delivery of materials for President Trump's controversial border fence for three hours Wednesday morning.

They showed up at 5:30 in the morning, and stood at the entrance to Stinger Bridge and Iron, blocking semi trucks from leaving the facility with steel poles destined for the border.‚Äù

The protesters said they were protesting the desecration of sacred tribal land and the impact of construction on native species and wildlife.

azfamily.com

Native American protesters block border fence material delivery

The protesters said they were protesting the desecration of sacred tribal land and the impact of construction on native species and wildlife.The protesters said they were protesting the desecration of sacred tribal land and the impact of construction on native species and wildlife.

entry.title: "In March, Polis issued an executive order encouraging the...
entry.content:
Abolish ICE Denver

"In March, Polis issued an executive order encouraging the Department of Corrections to consider releasing significant segments of its detained population. But while approximately 16,000 prisoners could have been released under this executive order, fewer than 300 actually were let out before Polis allowed key parts of the order to expire in May, according to a class-action lawsuit filed in late May by the ACLU of Colorado.

In that complaint filed in Denver District Court, th...e ACLU of Colorado asked a judge to order the Department of Corrections to either release medically vulnerable prisoners or at least better protect the medically vulnerable from the COVID-19 threat. The two sides have since agreed to a settlement of the suit, according to court filings, though the details have not been released. Citing ongoing litigation, Polis's office declined to comment on the lawsuit or other requests by decarceration advocates."

See MoreClose to 900 inmates in Colorado's prisons have contracted COVID-19.

westword.com

Advocates Urging Colorado to Release Medically Vulnerable Prisoners

Close to 900 inmates in Colorado's prisons have contracted COVID-19.Close to 900 inmates in Colorado's prisons have contracted COVID-19.

entry.title: Statewide, 883 inmates have tested positive for COVID-19 and 3...
entry.content:
Abolish ICE Denver

Statewide, 883 inmates have tested positive for COVID-19 and 3 have died.

When the pandemic hit Colorado, Gov. Polis issued an order allowing the early release of low-risk inmates with serious health conditions. But he's since allowed it to lapse.

cpr.org

Families Of Non-Violent, Medically Vulnerable Inmates Say The State Needs To Send Them Home

When the pandemic hit Colorado, Gov. Polis issued an order allowing the early release of low-risk inmates with serious health conditions. But he's since allowed it to lapse.When the pandemic hit Colorado, Gov. Polis issued an order allowing the early release of low-risk inmates with serious health conditions. But he's since allowed it to lapse.

entry.title: "Last week, federal Judge Michael Simon ruled that...
entry.content:
Abolish ICE Denver

"Last week, federal Judge Michael Simon ruled that journalists and legal observers were exempt from federal officers' physical force, arrest or other treatment if the officers "reasonably know" that a person is a journalist or legal observer.

But in a 2-1 decision, the judges on the 9th Circuit Court of Appeals, agreed with the government that Judge Simon‚Äôs initial ruling was too broad."

A three-judge panel on Thursday temporarily halted protections for journalists and legal observers covering the unrest In Portland, Oregon.

abcnews.go.com

Appeals court temporarily halts protections for journalists, legal observers in Portland

A three-judge panel on Thursday temporarily halted protections for journalists and legal observers covering the unrest In Portland, Oregon.A three-judge panel on Thursday temporarily halted protections for journalists and legal observers covering the unrest In Portland, Oregon.

entry.title: ‚Äú‚ÄúAurora is not a war zone, and the residents of our city...
entry.content:
Abolish ICE Denver

‚Äú‚ÄúAurora is not a war zone, and the residents of our city are not enemy combatants,‚Äù Juan Marcano, Aurora City Council Ward IV said in a statement. ‚ÄúOur police department is not trained in or required to use military use-of-force guidelines, and therefore should not be equipped with weapons of war.‚Äù
...
The city-wide laws would prohibit the Aurora Police Department from participating in the 1033 program, a federal program allowing the U.S. Department of Defense to push milita...ry equipment to local law enforcement agencies for more than 20 years. The program is often criticized by activists for helping create ‚Äúmilitarized‚Äù police forces ‚Äî an argument invoked Friday by the city councilmembers.
...
The plans would also ban police from deploying clouds of ‚Äúchemical weapons‚Äù such as ‚Äútear gas.‚Äù That‚Äôs an umbrella term for chemical compounds U.S. police commonly use to disperse and subdue crowds. Large-scale pepper spray use would also be banned.‚Äù

See More"Aurora is not a war zone, and the residents of our city are not enemy combatants,‚Äù Marcano said in a statement. ‚ÄúOur police department is not trained in or required to use military use-of-force guidelines, and therefore should not be equipped with weapons of war.‚Äù

sentinelcolorado.com

Aurora lawmakers to float ban on "tear gas," military equipment - Sentinel Colorado

"Aurora is not a war zone, and the residents of our city are not enemy combatants,‚Äù Marcano said in a statement. ‚ÄúOur police department is not trained in or required to use military use-of-force guidelines, and therefore should not be equipped with weapons of war.‚Äù"Aurora is not a war zone, and the residents of our city are not enemy combatants,‚Äù Marcano said in a statement. ‚ÄúOur police department is not trained in or required to use military use-of-force guidelines, and therefore should not be equipped with weapons of war.‚Äù
